title: Justin Bieber Boosts Tim Hortons Sales, CEO Calls Himself a 'Belieber'; Singer's collaboration on bite-sized doughnuts brought in younger customers, company says
text:
The Canadian coffee chain's partnership with Mr. Bieber started in November, when Tim Hortons launched a line of Timbits doughnut holes called Timbiebs. The company said Mr. Bieber helped come up with the three flavors: chocolate white fudge, sour cream chocolate chip and birthday cake waffle.

Tim Horton said Tuesday sales rose 10.3% in the fourth quarter at stores open at least a year, reversing its fortunes from the same period a year before, when that figure fell 11%.

Celebrity meals at fast-food restaurants have become a way to drive sales. McDonald's Corp., for example, has had deals with Korean boy band BTS, rapper Saweetie, singer Mariah Carey and reggaeton artist J Balvin.

Mr. Cil said Tim Hortons' partnership with Mr. Bieber did better than the company expected and brought in younger customers. He called it "one of the more successful traffic driving initiatives in recent memory."

With 220 million followers, Mr. Bieber is one of the most followed celebrities on Instagram. He used the social-media app to promote the doughnut holes, telling followers to go try his Timbiebs.

When the deal was announced in November, Mr. Bieber said he grew up going to the doughnut chain. Most of Tim Hortons' stores are in Canada, where Mr. Bieber was born.

"Doing a Tim Hortons collab has always been a dream of mine," the singer said in a statement at the time.

Mr. Cil said more is coming from the partnership, but didn't provide details.

Restaurant Brands International didn't respond to a request for comment.
